SENT.plain: Patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) appear to be at increased risk for development of neoplastic disease
We describe the case of a male teenager with SLE and Burkitt's lymphoma
His presentation was similar to that of an exacerbation of his underlying SLE
We believe this to be the first case of Burkitt's lymphoma in a patient with SLE
The association of SLE and malignancy, with emphasis on lymphoproliferative states, is discussed
